intro: Brunia glutinosa, commonly known as the sticky brunia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has sticky hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, adding a delicate touch to its ornamental value.
